messageBody:
Going back to the original question - how to log it. Could you use
AspectJ or similar so that you don't have to bother creating your own
version of all the assertXXX methods?


On Fri, 18 Feb 2005 02:42:20 -0500, J. B. Rainsberger
<jbrains@...> wrote:
> Chris Dollin wrote:
> > On Thursday 17 February 2005 15:18, Mike Clark wrote:
> > > I like how you think, Todd. :-)
> > >
> > > I don't know the history behind the design decision to use static
> > > methods in Assert, but I'd love to know.
> >
> > My *guess* would be that this allows them to be used without
> > having to inherit from, or have to hand an instance of,
> > Assert.
> >
> > Like, you want to put a JUnit-style assertion in a piece of code
> > that already exists.
>
> I would have preferred they use the Java logging idiom:
>
> class MyClass {
> private static final Assert assert = Assert.getInstance();
> ...
> }
>
> Now the assert*() methods can be instance-level.
> --
